snippet: Web-based mail is great -- until you don’t have an Internet connection.
lead_paragraph: Web-based mail is great  until you don’t have an Internet connection. To ease the separation anxiety, Google recently introduced a feature called Offline Gmail, which downloads a copy of your mailbox and all the recent messages when you do have Internet access, and then keeps it all available in your Web browser for when you don’t.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Reading Gmail Offline
